website_summaries.verdict: A solid pick if you want a highly rated cooling pad recognized for its simplicity and affordability.
pros: Comes with a built-in LED light and extra USB ports for further device use
Tilt feature can raise your computer by 1 inch, making it comfortable for typing
cons: A few buyers complained the fans run a little slow

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I uploaded a video so you guys can see how it fits perfectly for my asus rog laptop. Feel free to ask any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Azra Maximus

customer_reviews.title: does a great job of cooling my older hp that has a ...
customer_reviews.text: does a great job of cooling my older hp that has a bad fan in it, it no longer gets hot. This is a very quiet product, cannot hear it unless in extremely quiet setting, and then just fan sound. Love that this has a tilt feature, actually like using my laptop with this more than before. It does raise your laptop about an 1" minimum, but with the tilt feature it is very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, Doesn't Perform
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, but performs horribly. Fans spin extremely slow and there's not nearly enough air being pulled to cool my laptop. Maybe I just got a bad unit, but that doesn't change my review. I will leave my temperature tests below. I also reapplied thermal paste to my CPU about a few weeks ago also, using Arctic Silver 5. Before temps while idle: 64 degrees Celsius Before temps while under load: 85 degrees Celsius and thermal throttling After temps while idle: 63 degrees Celsius After temps while under load: 86 degrees Celsius and thermal throttling
customer_reviews.author: Earl W.

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet. EFFECTIVE.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars! Five MILLION stars!!! I work for a bank, so my hard drive is ridiculously encrypted. I have 3 versions of visual studio, ssms, and Oracle developer installed, each with a license specific to me - so imaging is out of the question. My laptop was *cooking*. The fan was in overdrive, but it was still burning up. Bought this to help save the hard drive from melting. It is damn near silent, and I'm in an office where it's quiet. And my laptop is COLD. The fan is calmly chugging away its worthless contribution while this thing does all the work. Where has this thing been for the last 3 years?!? I'm buying more.
customer_reviews.author: kimber

customer_reviews.title: Better without the lights
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the bright blue lights, so I ripped them out with pliers. It's really easy to unscrew the two pieces, and if you just yank the bulbs out or twist them until the wire breaks, the fans still work fine. I'm not sure what would happen if you cut the wires instead. This does a better job at keeping my laptop cool than I thought it would. I keep it plugged in to my laptop at all times and it doesn't seem to have too much of an effect on the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Fans quit a few weeks after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to leave a negative review, but the fans quit on this. The first fan stopped working just outside the 30 day return period. The second quit after that. One fan is still running. It's a shame the product is not built more solidly. I may buy another laptop cooler, but it will have to be a more robust and dependable product.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Thinker

customer_reviews.text: When i plug the usb cable into my computer, the fans don't run. i plugged it into a usb plug charger. the lights flash for two times and then it powers on and works. I will be getting another usb cable. I will try to see if it works with that. Update: 7/13/18. I ended up ordering a long usb cable. I plugged it in and hold the power button for a few seconds. Now it runs perfectly!!! Very quiet!!! Update 7/17/18 The power button is having issues. It won't stay on and keeps shutting off. update 7/22/18 : returning the product. When you press the power button, it keeps turning off. Doesn't stay on long enough.
customer_reviews.author: fallenangelessence

customer_reviews.title: Just want I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my computer a Lot. I play an Android game, and to do that, I must use an Emulator. An Emulator is a program that works in Windows and makes Android play available. Needless to say, it's double duty for my laptop. It used to get hot, though it is quite powerful enough to play both programs at once. I bought the Havit cooling pad, and could not be happier with it. It runs virtually silently. It is very well-built out of sturdy materials. It does everything it promises to do...keeps both the laptop and my lap cool. I believe that this will extend the life of my expensive laptop. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: sheridan gebhart

customer_reviews.title: OK - Simply a No Brianer - this product is awesome so far!
customer_reviews.text: I can keep this short. The product is exactly as explained. Has simple on-off switch and if you plug it into the right USB port it will turn on and off as you turn on and off your laptop. I bought a second one for my other Dell once I got the first one. Very quiet. Both my Laptops were hot after short use before I used this unit. They both are kept cool and their internal fan virtually never kicks on now. I could not be happier and am glad I read the reviews and when with this model. Very sturdy with aluminum top and strong, good feet. A very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Family of Five

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and both are dead already? Not even 6 months so will try another brand for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Roxelle P.

customer_reviews.title: Where is the air?
customer_reviews.text: This product has lovely blue lights that are on when it's receiving power, which is a good thing since I wouldn't know by the fans themselves that they were on. I don't feel any air at all moving from either side of this cooling pad - which also accounts for it's silent running. I can see some movement of the blades because of the flickering lights, but they might as well be behind glass for the amount of air flow. My laptop has shown no difference in the heat it gives off and I'd even be willing to hear some noise if it meant there was actual air flow cooling my laptop. Need to find a better cooling pad!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as promised, well packed and in great condition. This product worked perfectly for 8 months and did exactly what it was designed to do. On the 9 month it began to make noise. Turning it on and off several times seemed to work for a few weeks. Now it just makes noise constantly, like a bad fan bearing. My rating is based on my belief that this product should have performed for far more than 8 months. Disappointing to say the least
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: the functionality you want for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop cooling fan was great gift for my kid, he really loved the glowing blue. The fans are really quiet and the adjustable height helps lift if off the surface. The two USB ports don't really add extra USB ports, it acts as a USB pass through more than anything so you don't lose a USB slot. Maybe I'm really blind and I can't find where exactly I need to plug in so I plugged into one of the two ports. The On/Off toggle is nice giving an option to turn off the blue light/fan while still plugged in. When the device is turned off the pass through USB port still functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I wish I got one that you could change the RPMs of and that wasn't a glowing blue (no you can't turn it off unless you turn off the fan). I also wish I could move the fans to better suit my laptop fan distribution. As it stands I've actually been using it backwards so that the 2 fans sit at the back of my laptop where the 2 fans exhausts of my laptop sit. I would return, but I'm too lazy to seek out a new disappointing one at this moment. Lowers my temps by maybe 1-2°c. And elevates the comp which is okay I guess. Would love recommendations for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: N.Bae

customer_reviews.title: Best by far - distinct heat reduction
customer_reviews.text: My test was simple - the strip of casing north of the keyboard of my MacBook Pro is always ridiculously hot, and the fan always at full speed. (Apparently my laptop finds open browser tabs as taxing as nuclear simulations...but that's another story.) Could this fire be quenched? I tried a few other competitors and you could barely feel a breeze, and never felt a noticeable difference in temperature of my laptop casing when using them. With this one, it went from hot, almost too hot to touch, and maintains it at just warm. Like Goldilocks. Huge difference. I am now confident the battery will degrade from heat at a much slower rate.
customer_reviews.author: E. Montalban

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the hype was
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this product got such high ratings, but I also never owned a cooling pad before so I have nothing to compare to. This seems very useful for laptops that exhausts heat from the bottom side, but for ones that have the heatsink on the sides, this doesn't seem to do that much even though it dropped a couple degrees. The pull isn't that strong either, but it is fairly quiet, so you sacrifice one for the other. My other gripe about this is the rubber feet towards the front are terrible, they've already started falling off and don't have a lot of grip (on glass anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: My laptop is burning hot on this cooling pad!
customer_reviews.text: The fans spin, but there is no airflow. This pad simply does nothing at all. I almost burned my hand when I touched the bottom of my laptop after it was on the cooling pad for several hours. I got it to replace an old cooling pad (different brand) that had gotten noisy. After 2+ months of trying this new pad over and over with no cooling at all, I just went back to my old one, and within seconds, my laptop was cool again. I thought maybe my unit is defective, but if so, why does it light up and the fans spin? I do not recommend this pad at all!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Good Air Flow, Sturdy Enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cool my various network equipment (Modem, Router, PoE Switches etc.) Just stood it on the shelf and placed the devices on top of it. Tidy, cool looking, quiet and reduces the internal temperature of my router by more than 20C (which will quadruple the life - I'm an electrical engineer and this is true !). Wish I'd thought of this years ago. Going to buy another for my battery charger line-up in the garage.... they run hot sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Gary271

customer_reviews.title: Fan noise after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful laptop stand, I wish I could write a better review. But, after just 3 months of very basic usage, one of the fans is going bad, and there's an obnoxious noise now that has me unplugging it. When I say basic usage, I have a laptop that sits on it full time. It sits on my desk. It's not like I'm trekking it through the woods or beating up on it somehow. It sits here, not moving, not being touched, jostled, or beat up. And yet, I now have to replace it because I can't handle the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Chadd

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: i have a gaming laptop that will heat up noticeably and the fans get so loud that you have to turn up the volume... but this thing works great, it raises the laptop off the surface to allow air flow and the 3 fans provide tons of air. about the only criticism i have, is no high/low setting. the reason i say that, is because i notice air flow around the laptop despite the laptop being the same width or slightly wider then the cooler pad, which leads me to believe the laptop simply can't use all the air being pushed towards it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: No Crashes Since Using
customer_reviews.text: I have a very old 17" laptop that kept crashing. It would get real hot around the battery area and I was going to replace it (battery) but decided to try a cooling fan first. I have used this product for almost a month and not once have had a crash. I felt around the battery area and it's not hot like it use to get. ( a little warm is all) So far I am happy with this product and love to be using my old laptop again. I saved a lot of money not buying a battery or replacing my laptop. I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty...and that's it
customer_reviews.text: This is basically worthless as a cooling fan for any electronics. The fans are turning but even with my hand directly on top of it, I can hardly feel any air. I bought it to cool a laptop and then some external drives when I'm not using the laptop. The internal temp doesn't change one degree on the laptop or the external drives when using it. Also, the USB cord juts out from the back so it can't sit directly against a wall. So, it's a paperweight. The blue led's are pretty so there's that I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: The Scraggler

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and cools
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my laptop that I soon discovered overheats easily due to a design flaw and being so compact. First of all I must say how surprised I was as to how quiet this is. You can't tell its even on. It keeps the laptop from over heating. I gave 4 stars only because I would perfer for it to either have an option to turn on the blue lights or not have it at all. Although it looks cool, it can be very distrating and unnecessary especially if you are trying to be discrete. Otherwise so far so good...ir shall I say great!
customer_reviews.author: Reed's

customer_reviews.title: What Air Flow? There Is None!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how anyone could give this worthless “fan” a positive review. If you trust one review, make it this one. Turned it on, saw the fans start moving, but felt no air flowing through the device. I placed a piece of tissue paper over them to see if any air flow would register, and nothing, no movement...nothing. Seriously, my 5 lb chihuahua passes more wind when he has gas than this crummy fan does. Don’t waste your money on this defective worthless product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick The Unsaved

customer_reviews.title: Fixed overheating gaming laptop. Lasted 17 months.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Started making a terrible noise after 17 months. Downgraded from five stars to four However, it works and our son likes the way it looks, do a I ordered a new one. See original review below. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Gaming laptop was overheating. When I set it on this unit, you could feel the hot air forced out the side vents due to markedly increased airflow. I checked again a few hours later and the air coming out of the side vents was no longer hot, but just mildly warm indicating it eliminated the heat build up. Since using this, the device has stopped shutting down due to overheating.
customer_reviews.author: SerenePDX

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference of 1 or 2 degrees C on CPU Temp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the fans on my new MacBook Pro were going pretty crazy when I was working with video. While I waited I got an app that tracks my CPU temperature, and found that the internal fans were keeping the CPU fairly cool (70 - 80 degrees C under load once they kicked in). I have since received the laptop cooling pad, and in monitoring CPU temperature it seems to only make a difference of about 1 or 2 degrees C. Not really what I'm looking for. I'm going to return it and look for something more useful, or maybe just do without one.
customer_reviews.author: joekun

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler pad, don't care for LED lights.
customer_reviews.text: +Effective at keeping the laptop body cooler on my aluminum Spectre X360 15". +Won't lower CPU/GPU more than a couple degrees but takes some stress off the system, and heat is a known laptop killer. +Nice angle with the legs raised. -LED lights are just stupid. If they had a switch they might be ok. I was barely able to clip them off the fans carefully with electronics snips. Painting them black would work for most and be safer. Very nice with no LEDs. -Cooler will keep drawing power from laptop when sleeping. Would be better if it switched itself off when computer sleeps but then it would not cost 20 bucks either.
customer_reviews.author: Cornieleous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I use my gaming laptop for sims 4. But it gets super hot and I like to binge play for hours lol got this fan and I’m good to go! Can play all night without it barely getting warm. Fan is also so quiet that I have to double check to make sure it’s on since I can’t hear it. :) the lights on the fan are literally pointless so if they don’t have the color you want in stock, just buy another color. You’ll never even see the lights anyways lol
customer_reviews.author: Joci McCann

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but you cannot turn lights of if unit is on
customer_reviews.text: Havit HV-F2056 15.6"-17" Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad. The second picture down on the left hand side says on/off switchable lights. This leads you to believe the lights are controlled separately from the fans. Not true! The ONE switch controls both lights and fans, FALSE ADVERTISING. Otherwise, the unit seems nicely made and is quiet if the object to be cooled is placed properly on the pad. I had to position my router towards the back of the pad or I got definite fan noise. I paid $23.99. I see price has gone up to $33. Not worth that. Does not include a charger, just a USB cable. I am considering returning due to the lights staying on.
customer_reviews.author: MBrett

customer_reviews.title: Better Review!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot find my old review...ugghhh. (If anybody can help me on how to edit an old review, that would be appreciated) Anyway, I received this product, it didn't seem to work correctly and my past review reflected that. The company reached out to me!!!! Impressive!!! They were amazing to communicate with and super helpful, again, impressive!!!! My issue was resolved quickly. I would recommend this product and company in a heartbeat!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows absolutely no air! Laptop is just as hot as ever while gaming. This thing must be defective. I’d give 0 stars if possible. I only bought it since it was one of the best rated fans for laptops on amazon. What a scam!!!! Edit: They replaces the item for free which is great but it turns out. It wasn’t defective. The product just sucks that bad. Lol keeping a 1 star review. This item is for playing Minecraft or runescape not actual good games that make your pc get warm/hot. It will not keep it cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Medina

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, but leaves streak.
customer_reviews.text: After my 9 year old laptop crashed from overheating, I decided to buy this cooling pad. It saved me from another crash today, when I felt the overheating come on during a video conference. I immediately turned on the fans of the cooling pad and shut down programs and web pages that weren’t essential to the video conference I was on. Within minutes, the laptop’s fans subsided and the heat was dissipated. Only gripe is with the rubber pads of the legs. If you drag the unit across a white surface it will leave streak marks. Overall, a great device and would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jL

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I have a ROG Zephyrus 15.6" gaming laptop and felt like it was getting hot while playing the latest Modern Warfare. I bought this cooling pad and it seems to work well. Simple USB connection and an on/off switch. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that originally it was whisper quiet but after maybe 10 hours of use the fans got noticeably louder. It hasn't moved from my desk so rough handling hasn't had anything to do with whatever caused this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cooling Pad
customer_reviews.text: Our family owns several different cooling pads, and to date this has to be the best one we have owned. Love how light weight it is, but so sturdy. Another feature that I like is the ability to fold the two back legs up into the pad frame making it easy to place inside my carrying bag along with the laptop. The 3 fans are so quite that you would never know that they are running. I love the soft blue lights that are built into the frame giving it such a cool relaxing glow. Wish I could leave a photo or two with my review, but looks like Amazon has taken that feature off the product review section, sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Kraston S

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Runs very quiet; appears to be keeping the laptop running cooler evidenced by the laptop fan not going to high speed as often while gaming. Wish it had a smart switch that turned the cooler on and off with the laptop. Always seem to forget to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: H. Kon

customer_reviews.title: Light doesnt turn off
customer_reviews.text: On the left side, at the top, 2nd picture from the top, says "on off switchable blue LED light". Bought this because I dont want blue lighting in my space. That is a bad chinese translation, Im assuming, or else its false advertising. Because the switch turns the power off/on, not the lights. Its a fine product otherwise, and so many good reviews, i flagged this one star just so it wouldnt get lost in the mix and be seen by someone who like myself might be confused by that wording.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Why is it so hard to include an activating switch so it turns on when you put the laptop on it?
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, does it take an Einstein to add an activating switch so it turns on when you put the laptop on it? And no, adults don't need the disco light with it, no lights, can you understand, we are using it for work, not some teenage videogames. Pros: quiet, fits a 15" laptop well. Cons: * Doesn't have a switch that activates it when you put laptop on it. * Have the darned blue light inside of it. Grow up already, adults are using this for work. * The USB cable started having connection problems after 10 month of daily connects/disconnects, had to buy a replacement for five bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Marko DiPollo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cooling Pad for my 15" laptop
customer_reviews.text: Although I've used cooling pads before, this is the first one I've purchased for my personal laptop. The cooling pad does a great job reducing the heat generated when I'm charging and/or using my laptop. It's very quiet and compact. I love the blue color when turned on. I find the on/off switch useful. Other cooling pads I've used I had to unplug the pad. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BoomerLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Macbook Pro Cool as  a Cucumber
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my MBP fan running full steam and my computer bogging down due to heat issues - combine that with a sometimes hot, humid climate and it really puts a strain on your computer. I will say this fan really helps my computer perform, Ive seen tests on youtube that show that these fans do almost nothing to the temperature of the computer but in this case I think it works. Ive owned it for awhile now and often forget to turn it off but its still running strong and quiet. The only option that would be nice is to turn off the blue lights otherwise Im super happy!
customer_reviews.author: PhotoB

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop cooler.
customer_reviews.text: This three fan cooling dock works great I have owned it now for several months. Their is very little noise and it has some blue lighting that it gives off to add to your gaming anesthetic. It has two legs on one side of it to add a tilt to be a bit more ergonomic for when you are typing on your laptop. There is some flex to it and the fans can sometimes hit the casing if you are too rough with it while moving it around. Other than that this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: MDVidge

customer_reviews.title: This thing is garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in August, now in November and it just randomly stops working--sometimes if I shake it a bit it comes back on but holy cow, this thing is absolutely worthless. I'm not naive, I consider laptop cooliing pads to be fairly disposable items but I do expect to get at least a year or two out of one before it craps out. Three months, that's a record, and not a good one. Save your money, get something that doesn't suck.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Aleq

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my AMD laptop cool during any season.
customer_reviews.text: I love the color blue so the product automatically had my attention when it had a deep glow of blue. I do not have any proof that it cooled off my laptop but it did make a difference in how the surface of the laptop felt with extended use. The product has an exclusive plug so don't loose it and it is for a USB port so plug it in and it will work.
customer_reviews.author: John Claudio

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this cooling pad is slim and very quiet when on, however, the "anti-skid board" is literally just a 1mm dip in the metal mesh, so it doesn't prevent my laptop from sliding. The cooling pad works well when doing casual work on my Macbook Pro, but when I'm recording and rendering video, I still have to utilize another external fan to cool my laptop down. I'll keep this product since I like the slim design and the fact that it elevates my laptop to allow for more air circulation underneath, but if you're looking for something with hard-core cooling effects, spend some extra bucks on something more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Dual action and fits my 15" inspirion
customer_reviews.text: I just received this cooling pad and my initial impressions are great. It runs quite and also has an added benefit that other cooling pads didn't provide me. Laptops generally get warm right? Well if you have a warm laptop on your lap this can be uncomfortable and you start to get hot. This cooling pad also cools you and your laptop. Personal AC for all.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: keeps my laptop cool when I play the sims
customer_reviews.text: ok, my MacBook Air gets so hot when I play the sims that I had to give it cool down breaks (also my laptop was sooo noisy). Love this thing. It works great to keep laptop cool with less noise than the computer. You can hear this fan, but not too bad. I am very sensitive to noise & have trouble hearing with noise & this does not bother me. The blue lights are really cool. I like that there is a switch for on/off without unplugging it. I will be getting another one for the kids laptop so they will stop stealing mine. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: VIMermaid

customer_reviews.title: It's like a portable fridge for your laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I'm seeing at least 10-15 degree Celsius drops in my hardware under hi load. The lowest I've seen is 20+ degrees cooler. The only downside is the fans are arranged with most of the airflow being pushed underneath the FRONT of my laptop while all of the cooling and ventilation ports are at the REAR of my laptop. This means I have to spin the cooling pad around and the riser feet are now useless. It still works the right way around but I'll only get about 5-10 degree drops at the most. Can't fault the pad for that though.
customer_reviews.author: chazkez

customer_reviews.title: High-quality cooling unit
customer_reviews.text: I use mine with a 17" gaming laptop, and I've noticed a drop in temps since getting it set up. There are 3 fans that (noiselessly) provide a substantial amount of airflow. They appear to be around 100mm. [I stand corrected. The product description says they're 110mm running at 1000RPM +/- 100RPM]. There is a USB pass-through on the back that definitely comes in handy, and you can shut the whole thing off with a single switch in the rear if you need to for some reason. The lighting is the icing on the cake. I'd definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Nat Russo

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, efficient and reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my laptop kept cutting its frames from 70fps to 30. I thought it was a product malfunction, because there is no reason for that to happen with the powerhouse that I had purchased. I was using an HDMI cable to connect my laptop to another display device and shutting the lid for storage. Turns out I was shutting the heat in and it wasn't able to properly cool itself. Although I still keep the lid shut, this has brought the laptop back to optimal performance. I was wondering why the fans on my laptop ran so loudly, this actually brought the noise level down. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Mofobian

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice laptop cooling fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice laptop cooling fan. I have both the HAVIT 5 Fans Laptop Cooling Pad for 14-17 Inch Laptop and this one, the HAVIT HV-F2056 15.6"-17" Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad with three fans. I actually prefer to use this three fan Havit over the five fan Havit. It simply does a better job of cooling my laptop. I don't know if it's the bigger blades or the configuration of the blade locations that makes this three fan model more effective than the five fan model. In any event, I can honestly recommend this fan to anyone looking for a quality laptop cooling fan at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sichuan

customer_reviews.title: This does nothing to cool  laptop
customer_reviews.text: Returning. I'm in need of a GOOD cooling pad for my gaming laptop. It's gets really hot. Despite the good reviews for this, there's barely any air movement and it does nothing to cool a laptop. I even took temp measurements. Zero change. This simply just isn't powerful enough to cool a true gaming laptop. The reviews about it being quiet are true - but that's because there's no power behind the fans. Definitely not worth the hefty price tag it came with. It also does NOT have anti-skid, which is a must. Laptop slipped off on multiple occasions. Don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I love this cooling pad - it is the perfect solution ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooling pad - it is the perfect solution to my super-hot laptop. I have an older computer that still works well, but it was constantly running hot and it was pretty loud. Now that I've been using this cooling pad for a few weeks, I see a big difference. My computer hasn't gotten hot anymore (except when I forget to turn the pad on, then the hotness is my sharp reminder). I also have a lot less of the noise of the computer's internal fan working hard. This pad also travels well and is very comfortable on both my desk and my lap. Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quiet fan for using on desktop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the laptop I use at work. I am very pleased with it as it is functional, quite and seems to circulate air well. It is perfect for what I bought it for. Ergonomically it is okay, though I tend to use a separate keyboard/mouse so that wasn't my primary requirement. I think I will also look for a different/similar one that is slimmer/smaller so that I can travel with it - I travel a lot for work. An ideal size/footprint for me would be 8.5"x11". Regardless, I feel it is a good value and I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Weak. piece. of. garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Okay I got this because my laptop overheats. And it was also Amazon's Choice. But let me tell you about how USELESS this cooler is. ITS SO WEAK. WHO THE HELL CARES IF IT MAKES NOISE? DAMN SCREAM THAT YOURE BLOWING AIR BUT DO YOUR DAMN JOB AND COOL MY LAPTOP. "oh but its so quiet" "oh wow i can barely hear it" DO YOU WANNA KNOW WHY YOU CANT HEAR IT? BECAUSE IT ISNT DOING ANYTHING, IT MIGHT AS WELL BE OFF. I know I'm really angry and i should calm down but seriously this wasn't cheap. But it is Cheap. So yes I am upset and you should probably not buy this if you want something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio A. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Cooled my son's gaming laptop by 10 degrees - works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son has a gaming laptop that was overheating and crashing during long gaming sessions. The game had a bar along the top that showed frame-rate and CPU temperature. After installing this laptop cooling fan base, the temperature during game play dropped over 10 degrees, and the game no longer crashes. The noise level is fine - quiet, and it turns off when the laptop is off (if that's not obvious), which is ideal. I have no problem recommending this cooling pad for laptops in the 12-17" range. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome cooling pad. Its very quiet but still moves air quite well. I wasn't to sure about the lighted fans, but when the notebook is on top of the pad it actually makes a nice glow in dark rooms. It has an on/off switch on the back along with 2 USB ports (one will be used by the power cord of course). I haven't plugged anything else into the extra USB port so not sure of its capabilities. I REALLY dig that it has some feet to help prop up my laptop! Bonus! Overall definitely worth it, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop cooler
customer_reviews.text: It has been very warm (triple digit heat outside) and my laptop has been crashing frequently as my telework computer room temps can be rather warm (80 F). So far this cooler has helped prevent the crashing. It also looks nice, very well built, quiet, and easy to use. Best of all, I got this on sale for under $29. There is no fan adjustment on this model. It is either on or off. This adds to the simplicity as the setting is perfect. The Core i7-9850H in my Dell laptop does get hot and this cooling pad keeps it happy.
customer_reviews.author: RLewTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: 2nd purchase - still happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd purchase of this product. It's been our favorite cooling pad and has lasted way longer (about 2 years vs. 6-9 months) compared with others we've used in the past. The three fans cool down the laptops very quickly. We bought the 2nd one a few months ago since my husband started working from home full-time. My original cooling pad that I use for 8 hours or more, every single day, has started getting a little flaky, but when it conks out completely we plan on buying the same thing again to replace mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kel_A_1

customer_reviews.title: Laptop slides down
customer_reviews.text: The cooling pad does its job and prevents my 15 inch MacBook Pro from overheating. The fan is slightly noisy, but I got used to it after a while. However, for recordings, I have to turn it off. I’m not impressed by the slippery surface of the cooling pad. Whenever I place my laptop on it while the legs are extended, my computer slides down. It only stays in place if I hook the monitor over the cooling pad’s upper side. This, however, interferes with the view of my external monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Bluevanilladonkey

customer_reviews.title: Airflow is not as strong as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I actually put a Mac Pro 2013 on it. I should say it helps to some extent. I would like the maker of this cooler design a product specifically for the Mac Pro 2013, to reduce its thermal problem. I am sure it will have a market. I will order one if such a cooler is available. A cooler for the Mac Pro 2013 can have a smaller circular base, with one stronger fan, instead of three weaker fans this cooler currently has -- I understand that the current cooler is designed for a laptop in mind.
customer_reviews.author: mlc

customer_reviews.title: Temps went from 91c to 76c.
customer_reviews.text: I mine cryptocurrency with my laptop and was very worried I was going to cause my graphics card to overheat. Before I bought this cooling pad I was often times reaching internal temperatures of 91c. After getting the fan I peak around 77c but more commonly sit around 76c. Now the fans themselves are quiet, and while I do think they help cool my laptop down, I think the main contributing factor to the cooling is the stand, which lifts the laptop off the surface, allowing for more airflow to circulate beneath. For the price I paid I can say this purchase was definitely worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Drekly

customer_reviews.title: Cools well, slippery surface made it impossible for me to use
customer_reviews.text: The unit was pretty quiet and I suppose it worked as advertised, but I wanted something to put on my lap while watching TV (yeah, aren't we all multitasking nowadays?) The laptop cooler kept my lap reasonably cool from my hot laptop computer, but the surface of the pad is way too slippery. Even with good rubber feet on my MacBook, the computer slid off far too easily. I gave it a long test....a long chance to see if maybe my actions were the problem, but no, it was the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stout

customer_reviews.title: Good cooling pad.
customer_reviews.text: Does it job well, although it didn't really help me with my thermal issues. Either way it's an issue for me and my overheating laptop. As a tip- before buying any cooling pad make sure you under volt and apply thermal paste to your laptop first. then see if you still need a cooling pad. But I like this because it also provides elevation.
customer_reviews.author: Eleassar F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this right now!!
customer_reviews.text: My computer was getting really overheated especially with all the video calls and various things I was doing throughout the day. I have a 2017 MacBook pro with touch bar and idk what it is about these but it's been one problem after the other. This eliminated the overheating almost instantly. I can charge my phone, video call, and watch a movie all at the same time and it just makes my computer slightly warm. Even my roommate was shocked by how silent the cooling pad is and how cold the air it pushes feels. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Oli

customer_reviews.title: USB Plugs are Low Quality, Breaks in 2 Months of Use
customer_reviews.text: This seemingly simple device has a serious weakness: the USB connectors on the back. I used it for a few months, and it's quiet and cools my overheated laptop down nicely. But after a few months of occasionally plugging and unplugging it, the USB connections on the back failed. You would have to hold the wire just perfectly for it to make an electrical connection, and a slight touch is enough to lose it. Not sure if it's a manufacturing defect or a design flaw, but it's clear that the build quality of these connectors are so-so.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sander

customer_reviews.title: Kind of just.. didn't work?
customer_reviews.text: So this whole product kind of confused me. It didn't blow air out so I assumed it just sucked the hot air in and redistributed it outside. Honestly, it wasn't enough for me as my computer remained hot. However, the thing I didn't like the most was how slippery it was. I couldn't prop the fans up with the legs because when I put my computer on it afterward, it'd slide off. The surface is very cheap and plastic-y and seems flimsy. Maybe this would work with thinner computers but honestly, it just didn't work the way I wanted it to. It didn't work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Maninder Chadha

customer_reviews.title: NO AIR COMES OUT
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this product but I must leave a review to warn others. I loved everything about this except the fact that it doesn’t actually cool my laptop. I simply feel no air coming from this contraption which has 4 fans. I just don’t get it. How do you expect to cool a laptop with no air flow? Oh well you’ve been forewarned. I don’t know, maybe I got a defective one, but I have nothing to compare it to and the fan blades appear to be moving so I think it just doesn’t do the job.
customer_reviews.author: KandyKaine10

customer_reviews.title: Slip 'n Slide
customer_reviews.text: Wow I was so disappointed with the function of this product. Yes it looks cool(annoying how I can’t turn off the led lights though) and keep my computer cool, great. However it’s useless to use with a computer that doesn’t have a completely rubberized bottom. My MacBook Pro slides off after legit 30seconds of being on this thing when it’s in the inclined position, which this item needs to be on to allow enough air underneath to cool your computer. How this got soo many 5 star review I have no clue
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: HAVIT makes excellent products with superior customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17" ASUS ROG Gaming Laptop. I've installed extra RAM and another HD and it gets pretty hot when gaming. I have had this fan for almost a year now and it has not only worked wonderfully, but has LASTED (quite unusual - most I've purchased have gone belly up after a matter of months). The only down side is that several rubber feet on the bottom have come off. I contacted their customer service and they directed me to find replacements and were extremely helpful. Quite impressed with their communication with me actually. I will purchase my next fan from them as they have earned my business.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel_Chaser

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this on arrival. One of the fans did not work.
customer_reviews.author: D. Baluch

customer_reviews.title: Too many issues
customer_reviews.text: The lights are blindingly bright, and there's no way to turn them off or dim them while the fans are running. Also, while the top metal grill is of sturdy quality, it's way too slippery, so my laptop won't stay put. Other designs have a peg or flap to hold the laptop in place, but not this one. The bottom half is plastic, so if you pick it up with a computer on it while it's running, the plastic will bow and cause the fans to grind. Returned 2 days after I bought it. Only reason I'm not rating 1 star is because it does cool the laptop well.
customer_reviews.author: RetroDad

customer_reviews.title: I love this laptop fan!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, this is the best laptop fan I’ve ever owned. The design is nice. The fan is QUIET! I was really surprised by that. I was expecting some sort of noise I had to get used to, but there really isn’t any noise. I gamed for a few hours with this on and my laptop kept cool. Usually I have to take a break to let my laptop cool down, but I didn’t have to with this on! I think this is worth the $40. I’ve been disappointed with fans in the past, but this one is a gem to me. It’s a really good fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: StevieJay

customer_reviews.title: Undecided yet.
customer_reviews.text: First impression is a ok product. I don't like the led blue color lights I prefer nothing but the main reason I bought this is to cool my laptops. Still have to test this. I will update my review if necessary. I wish the USB cable was connected to the cooler and not as plug in. I can live with that. For me seeing the air fins at the bottom of the laptops, I wish the two fans were at the top and the center fan was at the bottom. Personal opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Vittori

customer_reviews.title: wish it has some thing to keep my mac from sliding around other than that it works great , keeps my mac cool while on my lap
customer_reviews.text: ive tried many laptop coolers for my mac book pro 2011 and most hardly work...my laptop gets hot and with this one it does not the fans are silent and seem to keep my laptop cool... the only problem is they have no stoppers for the laptop on the cooler itself...which means my mac slides around on it...i'm going to by some rubber stoppers or somethin to hold my laptop in place and most people that do reviews of laptop coolers only talk bout it on a hard surface..where i wanted on to put on my lap ...and this one is the ticket to keep it from burning you...just need somethin to keep it from sliding around
customer_reviews.author: chaik george

customer_reviews.title: A year later
customer_reviews.text: A YEAR LATER- The pad still works, though just barely. It seems to be holding on by a prayer, The USB ports within the pad have fallen out, and they jiggle when in its space, but surprisingly they still work, depending you don't move so much. The cooling still works, though not as well as when I got it. It's very quiet and it does let off a little breeze, but the underside of my laptop feels more like a lukewarm bath rather than the frozen tundra it used to be when I purchased it. Overall -after a year later- I believe it's still a good product
customer_reviews.author: nani

customer_reviews.title: Like a refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is amazing. Really nicely engineered, quality parts, assembly and design. One key point: I originally had it laying flat on the desk as my laptop was docked, and it didn't seem to cool the laptop as much as I had hoped. So I thought, lets open the legs up, let it breathe...and holy crap! It actually *chilled* the bottom of the laptop. Wow! So the moral of the story is, unfold the legs and this thing will keep your laptop at below room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Wintermute

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is doing exactly what I needed it to do. It's keeping my laptop much cooler while gaming. The fan is extremely quiet - you barely know it's on. The surface is a sturdy, powder-coated steel mesh. Very smooth with no rough edges. The flip-out legs in the back put it at an easy angle for typing. Had planned to only use it while gaming but it's so comfortable, I'm leaving it up all the time. Large enough surface for a big laptop (mine is a 13" MacBook Pro so there's a bit of unclaimed real estate around the sides!) Well made and designed.
customer_reviews.author: badhorse

customer_reviews.title: Picture implies bottom stops that aren't on actual product - slip sliding away...
customer_reviews.text: While the image attached to the product listing shows this item with three raised areas at the bottom to keep your laptop from slipping off when raised, the actual product does not have these - having a slightly depressed area where the fans are instead. This may work for smaller laptops (12-13 inches) but for a 15 inch I am having to adjust frequently as the laptop slowly slides down over a session. Am looking for some small pegs or rubber bumpers I can add on since this is one of the lighter stands out there, and it DOES have good airflow. But it all comes to naught if it isn't reliable in use.
customer_reviews.author: Ewan Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my laptop really cold!
customer_reviews.text: I have two laptops, a Lenovo Yoga 910 and a Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Extreme and for my Yoga it cools really well because of the aluminum body. The thinkpad doesn't cool quite as well but it doesn't get as hot as it used to. Keeps my laptops comfy to work with and keeps me from worrying about them both getting too warm. I always forget to turn it off because of how quiet it is! I don't even notice it there. The blue light on it isn't too intrusive since I usually work in the day time but at night it could be a little bright, but most of it is blocked by the laptop itself.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Ancheta

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but if you are a gaming laptop please do n’t buy it because it ca n’t help you
customer_reviews.text: I read this product after reading the reviews of other people's help for the cooling of the game console, but the answer it gave me was no effect. When I did not get this fan, the CPU temperature was kept at 40 degrees, and I reached 80 degrees when playing the game, but After turning on the fan, the temperature remains unchanged, and there is no change. I observed that the change of the fan is very slow, which is difficult to achieve the effect of heat dissipation, so I am slightly disappointed with this product. Although its appearance is very good, may be useful for working computers.
customer_reviews.author: JunMa

customer_reviews.title: Nice Laptop Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This a good Laptop cooler. I have been using this from past 4 years and it has definitely helped my laptop to stay cooler and does its job perfectly. However, I dont like the blue lights from the cooling pad but it does what it is supposed to do and serves the purpose, especially when you play heavy intensive games on your laptop. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who has laptop heating issues. This will surely help your laptop to cool down better. It does consume a bit of more battery but reduces the heat which helps in better performance of the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my new Razer Blade 2019 gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I looked for when this arrived was to testing how loud it would be. Lets put it this way, it is so quiet, I didn't even know it was on. If it didn't have a blue light I wouldn't have known it was on. It kept my laptop super cool while playing games like FFXIV, Apex, and Doom etc. I also like the kick stand at the bottom for extra air flow. When on a flat surface air flows naturally through the vents and keeps the laptop extra cool. Its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: hellopk

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Only recently got this and have been quite impressed with it. I use my laptop on a lap desk and it was starting to run VERY hot, to the point where it was potentially going to burn my left hand and i'd have to shut it down. Usually just on it playing World of Warcraft. I've started using this cooling device in-between the laptop and the lap desk and it's made an enormous improvement. It will still get a little warm but nowhere near as hot as it used to and the device is super quiet, wouldn't know it was on if not for the blue lights.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Build Annoying LED Light.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality with reasonably quiet fan. Why three stars? Annoying blue light that can't be turned off. Willing to pay an extra 10 dollars to have this option.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Altmaeir

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Effective, Sturdy. This Pad Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Havit Cooling Pad : This pad rocks! It’s silent, made well, and cools decently. I have 4 of these pads, and use them with gaming laptops. Worth it. Please mark if you find this review helpful. With much gratitude, thank you, and hope this helps others. :D Pros: 1) Cools effectively 2) Quiet 3) Good rubber grips 4) Well ventilated 5) Sleek design 6) Energy efficient 7) Cool blue lights...makes me feel special Cons: 1) Metal mesh on top surface can be slippery for some laptops if they don’t have grips of their own
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought it alongside my laptop and have enjoyed using it over the past year I've had it. It's fairly quiet and produces a nice amount of air to circulate. It's also fairly sturdy and has absolutely no issue being on for many many hours at a time. My only issue with it is that the LEDs cannot be changed in color and the lights cannot be turned off without the fan being turned off. It seems they are wired the same way so one needs the other to be on but I imagine someone could rewire it or cut the wire. Great purchase, recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John Goldyn

customer_reviews.title: More time with my old Mac
customer_reviews.text: The fan died in my 2011 MacBook Pro. Of course, it would overheat, run slow, freeze up, and streaming movies was impossible. This fan brought everything back to normal, or as normal as a 2011 laptop is going to get. It's lightweight and quiet. I know I need a new computer, but this bought me some time until I do that, and for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Katydid

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wish it had more grip
customer_reviews.text: I got this product to cool my old MacBook with a cranky fan. As far as that goes, the fans are great! My only complaint is that it's so slippery, so my laptop is constantly sliding off of it. Or... it was, until I finally grabbed a few pieces of blue goo and stuck them on the bottom of my laptop, so now it stays put on the cooling pad. Ideally, the next iteration of this pad would have tacky spots on the four corners, or similar, to keep everything from moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Topping

customer_reviews.title: You can barely hear it
customer_reviews.text: There really ain't much to say about this laptop cooling pad other than it does its job perfectly and looks futuristic. There are three fans in this cooling pad and two cooling looking blue LED lights on each side of each fan. It runs extremely quite. My favorite part about it is it has an extra USB port on it so it not only doesn't occupy the USB ports of your laptop but it also really helps if you want to create a work station with a wireless USB keyboard and mouse combo.
customer_reviews.author: Boya

customer_reviews.title: Amazing noise levels
customer_reviews.text: This pad leaves your laptop cool (although haven’t bought/used it for gaming). Noise level is just wow! You won’t hear anything unless you stick your ear to it. Not sure why they kept the single fan at top of it and the 2 other fans towards to front part as the majority of laptops have the heat dispensing holes at the bottom towards the rear part...so shouldn’t the 2 fans to be located at the rear instead of front side?
customer_reviews.author: Khaldoon H.

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: The fan is very low. It barely cools my laptop. There is only one fan setting. And its powered by a double sided detachable USB. The USB isn't convenient if you have a wireless mouse, laptop charger, headphones or other laptop equipment to keep up with. If you misplace the USB cord (like I did) consider yourself SOL or be ready to spend more money to replace to cord. Overall, I would not recommend this product. It's too high maintenance, the fan power is extremely low, and did not successfully cool my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: It works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a gaming laptop. The laptop would heat up considerably, causing the internal fans to to kick into high gear, causing a lot of noise. The fans on this match with the intake for the laptop, so it does its job in pushing cooler air into the system, so that the GPU does not have to work as hard to cool under loads. I am one of the few that don't like the extra LEDs on everything, but when a laptop is on the cooler, it is less noticeable. I plan to remove them myself, since they are not controllable.
customer_reviews.author: Wuffy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, GREAT,  GREAT PRODUCT.  QUIET AND DOES THE JOB WITHOUT ISSUE.
customer_reviews.text: Great Cooling Pad. Took it out of the box... set it up in about 60-seconds. Turned it on... whisper quiet. Awesome product and was the #1 recommended cooling pat by CNET. Very quite. I work out of my home, and in fact my desk is in my bedroom. My only issue... and I'm just being a pain is that I wish I could dim the Blue LED lights, or turn them off... NOT REALLY A COMPLAINT. I would have to turn the fan off to turn the lights off. So, I just shut my system down which is probably a good thing anyway. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D Gawrys

customer_reviews.title: Basically useless
customer_reviews.text: I have a Predator Triton 500 with XTU setting. While I play FPS game, the CPU temperature is usually around 88-90 celsius, GPU around 80 celsius, and the system is around 80 celsius. When I put a laptop station under it, the temperature is usually decrease by around 5 celsius. I tried the fan, the temperature monitoring basically was showing THE SAME temperature as I just put a station under the machine. Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Friday Starks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Started using my MacBook Pro in the clamshell mode more ever since I got an external monitor. I noticed that it heated up a little quicker so I got this cooling pad. Worked perfectly! Immediately noticed a consistent drop in temperature. The pad is very quiet and slim, so it doesn't add a lot of bulk to my setup. I would like an option to turn the blue lights off, however. They can get a little distracting. Overall, excellent!
customer_reviews.author: dana Van steenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Metal casing...plastic fans
customer_reviews.text: My machine is getting too warm...it's been in the shop multiple times. I'm saving for a new one. Got this on discount, and it is a sturdy metal frame with plastic fans. NO noise that I can hear at all, but it's not a full on 'breeze" that I can feel. However, it DOES keep my machine cooler than I anticipated, so I'm thankful. The BEST bit, though is that this has TWO USB ports in it...one to connect it to your machine and one to take the place of the one it uses. VERY thoughtful design and I applaud the extra effort. No assumption on how long it lasts, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MollieDuke

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but effective laptop cooler - I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: This 3-fan laptop cooler does a good job of holding down the temperature on your laptop (but don't place it on your lap). It has a tilt feature (which improves cooling effectiveness), and it is very quiet. This was a replacement for an older, noisier single-fan unit () that ended up transferred for use on my wife's computer. I'd rate that one 3 stars due to noise, and isn't worth the $3 savings for the latter. Only improvement would be to add a few extra USB ports, which would make for a decent docking station.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG F

customer_reviews.title: Looks pleasing, but it's effectiveness in cooling is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is big and the design is pleasing to the eye. I have a MSI GT70 Dominator and this cooling pad was bought to try and keep my laptop cool without having to use the booster fan which sounds like a jet when on. I was hoping to see a bit of difference with the cooling pad without the booster fan on, but saw no difference. When my booster fan is on the temperature drops about 20 degrees in temperature. With this cooling fan, the temperature didn't drop but instead continued to rise. It looks nice, but its effectiveness in cooling down the computer I find questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Hee Min kang

customer_reviews.title: Real cool for Tivo
customer_reviews.text: I got these to keep my Tivo's cool. Nothing ruins a Tivo, or a laptop more than heat. We put a new bureau in the bedroom, and I noticed when I changed everything around, the feet of the Tivo were stuck to the top of the old bureau. That's hot. So, I didn't want this to happen to the new bureau, and came up with the idea of using the laptop cooler. Great idea, highly recommended. Love my Tivo's, but they aren't cheap to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan Dyer

customer_reviews.title: First one died...after 5 years!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm back to buy another cooling pad after the first one of these just died after 5 years. I looked at the newer model and liked the additional USB port but not the lights along the front. The original model [this one] has been a champ for me. It's slim & light enough to slide in a backpack's computer pocket for travel & I've taken it almost every time I've traveled. It's quiet and 3 fans do a great job cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Boston

customer_reviews.title: Bad Fan Placement --- Make Sure it Cools Where Your Computer Gets Hot
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. However it doesn't cool enough where my computer gets the hottest. My Thinkpad W520 gets very hot in the upper left hand corner (by the left hinge of the screen). I'm assuming that's where all the processing, etc., is happening. Unfortunately, the fans on this unit don't cover that area. My computer was getting so hot while processing video that it would abruptly shut down. I ended up buying the LotFancy version of this which has FIVE fans - including one in the upper left hand corner. And it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Greene

product_meta.title: havit HV-F2056 15.6"-17" Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad - Slim Portable USB Powered (3 Fans), Black/Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:Black+BlueSlim, Light Weight, and Portable 
Barely over an inch of thickness and only 1.6 lbs of weight, the HAVIT 15.6"-17" laptop cooler is ultra-portable and protects your investment wherever you go. 

Ergonomic Comfort 
With the help of ergonomic design and the 2 adjustable height setting, the HAVIT laptop cooler provides you with the most relaxing incline angle for all-day viewing and tying 

Optimized for Laptop Carrying 
The high-quality multi-directional metal mesh of HV-F2056 15.6"-17" laptop cooler provides your laptop with a wear-resisting and stable laptop carrying surface. 

Superior Cooling, Whisper Quiet 
Three large 110mm fans provide superior airflow at whisper quiet noise levels, spinning at just over 1,000 RPM. The HAVIT 15.6"-17" laptop cooler provides a strong 65 CFM of air flow allowing you to work all day without making any noise and interrupting your flow. 

Extra USB Ports 
Need extra USB ports while using HAVIT 15.6"-17" laptop cooler? Just plug it into one of the two USB ports on the laptop cooler. 


Specification 
Dimensions: 380mm L x 280mm W x 28mm H (14.96in. L x 11.02in. W x 1.10in. H) 
DC Fans' Sizes: Total of 3 fans @ 110mm L x 110mm W x 20mm H (4.33in. L x 4.33in. W x 0.79in. H) 
Rated voltage: 5V DC 
USB Ports: 2 
Speed: 1100 +/- 200RPM 
Material: HIPS and metal mesh 
USB cable length: 60cm (23.62in.) 
Air flow: 65 CFM
